resources.string: Plays alarm sound, displays a notification and pops up on screen
Go and scan Your QR Code!
QRAlarm needs an \"Alarms & reminders\" special app access to schedule alarms that can be fired at exact times. The access is revoked and thus must be granted via system settings.
QRAlarm needs access to Your phone’s camera in order to scan for QR Codes to disable alarms. Without this permission the app can not work properly.
QRAlarm needs access to Your phone’s camera in order to scan for QR Codes containing a new dismiss code.
Camera permission has been permanently revoked. Without it QRAlarm can not work properly. In order to fix it, go to settings and allow QRAlarm to use phone’s camera.
Camera permission has been permanently revoked. Without it You can not set a new dismiss alarm and dismiss alarms. Go to settings and allow QRAlarm to use phone’s camera.
Snooze over! Go and scan Your QR Code!
Set the duration of all snoozes in minutes
Set the number of available snoozes
Set the duration in seconds of alarm volume increase
The app will scan for both QR Codes and Barcodes
Download the default QR code image to gallery
QRAlarm needs access to Your phone’s storage in order to download a default QR Code that after being scanned will turn off alarms.

Storage permission has been permanently revoked. Without it QRAlarm can not download a default QR Code that after being scanned will turn off alarms. In order to fix it, go to settings and allow QRAlarm to use phone’s storage.
Failed to download the default QR Code…
Scan your own code for it be used to turn off alarms
The code “%1$s” has been set as the new dismiss code for the alarm. You can try scanning again for the code if the scan result is not what You wanted.
Check how to use and ensure stability of the application

QRAlarm lets You set alarms that can be turned off by scanning a QR Code. This can not be just any QR Code! Before You set up Your first alarm, You should Download a default Code Image from the Settings. In case You already have Your own QR Code then scan it - QR Alarm will remember it for You and will use it to cancel Your alarms! Note, that You can also enable the Barcodes support in the Settings.

Unfortunately many smartphone manufacturers prefer longer battery life (even if barely noticeable) over properly working applications! Samsung, OnePlus, Huawei, Xiaomi and many others tend to be killing applications while they are working in the background. QRAlarm can also suffer this problem! Many smartphone manufacturers kill the app completely along with the alarm that was set via the QRAlarm application. In order to fix this issue, please, go to dontkillmyapp.com and follow the instructions for Your smartphone - this should help mitigate the “optimizations” carried out by Your operating system.
Selected alarm sound has been saved!
QRAlarm needs the permission to post notifications when the alarm goes off. Without it the alarm will not be accompanied by the notification.
Notifications permission has been permanently revoked. Without it the alarm is not accompanied by the notification. Go to settings and allow QRAlarm to post notifications.
You are trying to disable Barcodes support. If Your dismiss code is tied to a previously scanned Barcode You won\'t be able to dismiss future alarms! Are You sure You want to proceed?
The alarm sound will be accompanied by vibrations
Notifies about currently set alarm or missed alarms, hides in the notification drawer, does not make sound

Please make sure that You have visited Settings and either downloaded the default QRAlarm QR code (“Download code” option) or scanned Your own QR/Bar code (“Scan new code” option). If you don’t have a default or your own code ready to be scanned YOU CAN’T STOP THE ALARM!
Yes - I have a valid QR/Bar code.
Cancel alarm without code if it is in more than 1 hour
Alarm in less than 1 hour. Cancel by scanning the code!
QRAlarm needs the permission to display full screen notifications on your lock screen when the alarm goes off. Please enable this functionality in the settings.
Your previously set alarm was missed likely due to time change on your phone
QRAlarm could not find the web browser application to open the link. If you believe the browser is installed - please, open the link manually.
